alert.note: Alert for Southern Oregon Coast; Western Siskiyou National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 18 at 1:26PM PDT until September 19 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM PDT TUESDAY FOR EAST WIND WITH POOR OVERNIGHT RH RECOVERY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2000 FEET IN FIRE WEATHER ZONES 618 AND 619... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 PM this evening to 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * AFFECTED AREA...Oregon fire weather zones 618 and 619, at elevations above 2000 feet. This includes mid slopes and ridges of the Kalmiopsis Wilderness, western Siskiyou National Forest, and the Anvil and Flat wildfires. * WIND...Northeast wind 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Recovery to 55 to 70% this evening, then falling to 20 to 30% late tonight through Tuesday morning. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.

area.areaDesc: Southern Oregon Coast; Western Siskiyou National Forest
